document_title: Colon cancer: Causes, signs and treatment
subsection_name: ung-thu-dai-trang.json_8_Nutrition for people with colon cancer
subsection_content: Add more vegetables, fruits, and whole grains: Accumulated waste is the cause of polyps formation, which over time develop into cancer cells. Research shows that adding lots of fiber-rich foods will help eliminate waste, reducing the risk of colon polyps by 40%.; Avoid greasy foods: You need to limit greasy foods because they will produce acid in the colon, causing tumors to grow quickly.; Supplement folic acid from plants: Folic acid found in citrus fruits such as oranges, grapefruit, tangerines... has been proven to reduce the risk of colon cancer.; Adequate calcium supplementation: Research shows that supplementing 700 - 800 mg of calcium/day will reduce the risk of disease by 40 - 50%. Besides, vitamin D will help absorb calcium more effectively.
